TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Please be patient for an update. Or roll your install back to 1.2.2

> 15 hours ago, Galileo said:
> 
> 
> Yes turning off the ocean shader fixes the floating terrain tiles.
> 

That's working for me as well, until a proper 1.3 Scatterer release comes out.

In the case of SVE I've had to edit the SVE\_Scatterer config directly, since it's a Module Manager config and any changes made to the Scatterer main menu settings are overridden by the SVE <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> configs.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Gordon Fecyk said:
> 
> 
> any changes made to the Scatterer main menu settings are overridden by the SVE <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> configs.
> 

Pretty sure [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) knows better than to ship configs with a FINAL statement, so there's no reason why you shouldn't be able to override the SVE config changes with your own

> 
> 
> 19 minutes ago, Drew Kerman said:
> 
> 
> Pretty sure [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) knows better than to ship configs with a FINAL statement, so there's no reason why you shouldn't be able to override the SVE config changes with your own
> 

I wouldn't put it past me ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)") 

i don't *think* I used FINAL but if I did, whoops! I'm pretty sure I used AFTER[scatterer] but all changes still will either be made by another <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> cfg or directly in the SVE directory regardless

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/69702-112-ksprc-renaissance-compilation-artworks-remake-v-07-pre-release-3/&do=embed"></iframe>

Well, today was a crazy day. I went home last night to find the videocard dying, artifacts and system freezes... Tired and disappointed I went to sleep.

Today I tested again and it was even more unstable, one of the crashes messed up my windows install and made it unrecoverable, I had to reinstall it.

Disappointed that another GPU died on me, I pulled it apart, cleaned it, and put it in the oven.

![fUFqRMd.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/fUFqRMd.jpg)

8 minutes at 200C later, I turn the oven off and get the card out.

I opened the window and went for a walk while the toxic fumes dissipate. Knowing I already did this with my previous card and it didn't help, I was skeptical.

I get home and apply some new thermal paste, put the whole thing back together, slide it back into my PC and lo and behold, everything works, it's been stable for 20 minutes in furmark now when before it would freeze 5 seconds in.

![qdc8Cyi.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/qdc8Cyi.jpg)

Success! I can get back to modding now.
